Leah, please look into this, it looks like the questionnaire page is missing.  Also, you may want to consider a mechanism for collecting bugs since this isn't a Mylar bug, but having it here is fine for now.

Created an attachment (id=39891)
Added condition for normal execution when no questionnaire extension is specified.

The monitor allows optional extension points for both a one-time-only background questionnaire, and for a periodic questionnaire which appears every time the user uploads data. The Mylar monitor currently throws an exception if one of these is not provided by the extending plug-in, but it shouldn't do this (Antoine only uses the background questionnaire). I've changed the code so it first checks if the extension attribute is specified before creating the executable extension for each questionnaire. I ran org.eclipse.mylar.tests.AllTests on this, and manually ran the Antoine plug-in upload wizard. 

(FYI, this bug does not critically affect the execution of the Antoine plug-in.)

traces.message: Executable extension definition for "questionnairePage" not found.
